result.execSummary:
The defendant Terrance Lee Lawrence Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Use Dangerous Weapon (Felony 2-5 Yrs)], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample- pay surcharge. Pay fine of $500.00 plus all applicable mandatory surcharges, fees, assessments, and costs by the end of probation period-any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment- agent to determine monthly payment plan.

Defendant is informed he may not possess and/or own any firearms.
Defendant is informed he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been reinstated.

No use or possession of any illegal substances.
No conduct rising to the level of probable cause.

Obtain AODA assessment and complete follow-up care/treatment.
Cooperate with random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terrance Lee Lawrence Jr

records.addlTxt: JusticePoint Pretrial Report, received and filed.

Defendant Terrance Lee Lawrence in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for sentencing.  Attorney Schubert had miscalendared the case.   Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg. Case adjourned for sentencing on 9/8/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 44.  aw  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Deputy Clerk;ds

Case heard for Br. 03.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as amended in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Defendant Terrance Lee Lawrence in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

On motion of the State, Court AMENDS the charge to reflect the correct statute for Use of Dangerous Weapon of 939.63(1)(c) 2-5 years.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Attorney Joseph Edward Schubert in court.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Case was calendared for plea hearing this date.  Defense request for an adjourned date is granted by the court.  Any motions by the state are to be filed by 06-01-15 and any response by defense is to be filed by 06-04-15.  Final pretrial  date and jury trial date are to be selected on the next court date.  Parties are advised that effective 08-01-15 this case will be reassigned to Branch 44 Judge Konkel  Status conference scheduled for 06-15-2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Terrance Lee Lawrence in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for plea and sentencing.  An issue arose to see if charge is eligible for the possibility of expunction.  Parties will research the issue.  Court grants parties request to adjourn plea and sentencing.  Case adjourned for projected guilty plea on 5/14/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  State also to file an amended information on the next court date.  Defendant to continue with Justice Point supervision.  aw  Plea hearing scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Terrance Lee Lawrence in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for plea and sentencing.  State has given defense a new offer.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 5/6/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  Defendant to continue to go to Justice Point.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

No action taken at this time.  Case remains calendared for Plea and Sentencing  on April 21, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 3.

Defendant Terrance Lee Lawrence in court with attorney Joseph E Schubert.  Step Nolten for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.
$1000.00 cash bail to be returned to the poster (remitter).  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Terrance Lee Lawrence in court with intern Gabriela Leija under the student practice supervised by attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.
